titleStmt.title: A. J. Warden et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG7465

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To His Excelency
Thomas E Bramlette
Governor of the Commonwealth of Ky

The undersigned your petitioners would represent, that at the September term 1865 of the Ballard Circuit Court, Judgement was rendered against J D. White for three Hundred Dollars, upon a Bail Bond entered into, as Surety J Eaging's, appearance in the Ballard Circuit Court to answer for malicious stabing, that Said Bond was given in November 1863 and that Soon after the execution the Dft Eaging left the state, and has not since returned We would farther represent that We believe, that White the Surety has done everything in his power to procure the appearance of Eagrieg. The premises considered We pray your Excelency to remit the fine as far as may be done by the Executive, and in duty will ever pray &C. We farther state that many of us know the fact that the Dft White in his anxiety to procure the appearance of Eaging offered a reward for his apprehension, and We all state that Such is our information

A. J. Warden
F W Bugg
Thomas Wright
J. W Bugg
J, D, White
J, B, Jones
C N Rollins
S C Penne.
O, F, Nichols
T J Juett

To His Excellency
The Governor of Ky
$300, Forfeiture
Petition
Remitted 9 Dec/65
